thread.title: University of Texas eliminates scholarship, program for undocumented students following state's DEI ban | Nation/World | gazettextra.com
thread.title_full: University of Texas eliminates scholarship, program for undocumented students following state's DEI ban | Nation/World | gazettextra.com

author: Marcela Rodrigues - The Dallas Morning News (TNS)
title: University of Texas eliminates scholarship, program for undocumented students following state's DEI ban | Nation/World | gazettextra.com
text: Officials at the University of Texas at Austin eliminated a scholarship for undocumented students, citing the state’s DEI ban and a federal immigration law, according to an internal communication. [The scholarship](https://hornraiser.utexas.edu/project/9567?utm_source=scalefunder&utm_campaign=amb_share&utm_name=xyavgmd7pbd0ykbxb052m2l&utm_medium=plain) – which ranged from $500 to $1,000 and was awarded annually – was part of [the Monarch Program](https://twitter.com/UT_Monarch), an initiative designed to support undocumented students. The program as whole was also eliminated as of Jan. 1, [as first reported by the student’s newspaper The Daily Texan](https://thedailytexan.com/2024/01/24/rooted-members-leave-to-pick-up-the-pieces-after-sb-17-shuts-down-partnering-program-monarch/). kAm“(96? x =62C?65 E92E E96J H6C6 E2 6?E65 DEF56?ED[ x H2D 7FC:@FD[” D2:5 {FA6[ 2?
